page.title: 15DARTMOOR RESCUE GROUP
page.content: The moor can be a dangerous place for those who are not well equipped or are unlucky enough to have an accident. It is very difficult terraine in which to gain the attention of the normal rescue services, even if you can find a call box to dial 999. The North Dartmoor Rescue Group has its headquarters in Okehampton which covers the northern part of the moor. They respond to calls for help with the knowledge and experience needed to find a casualty often in bad weather or isolated places and make a successful recovery. Members of the group train weekly for this voluntary service to those using the moor. Many of their call outs could be avoided if people went on to the moor suitably equipped for walking in this type of area.
